markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tense Negotiator](/Feats.aspx?ID=2261) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 53</row>

**Archetype** [Swordmaster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=33)

**Prerequisites**
[Swordmaster Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1139); Master in [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6)

</column>

---

You often find that the best way to win a conflict means avoiding a fight in the first place. You're good at talking to potential opponents without making things worse. If you would critically fail at a check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50), you instead fail. You can attempt checks to make [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) of creatures who're [indifferent](/Conditions.aspx?ID=25) or [unfriendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=40) toward you.
name: Tense Negotiator
